p: After its first recognition in the 1970s in Europe [ 7, 9], the disease caused considerable economic losses especially in Asia, where the disease remains endemic [ 10, 11]. In Europe, the disease disappeared quickly, and from most countries, only very sporadic cases were reported over the last three decades. After reports from Asia, that a new PEDV variant caused considerable losses [ 12, 13], that highly virulent PEDV variant emerged also in the United States (US) in 2013, with swine farms experiencing explosive epidemics affecting all age classes of animals, with up to 95% mortality in suckling pigs [ 2, 14].
